report_title: Bicycle Dealership & Repair Shops in the US
executive_summary: Bicycle dealerships and repair shops sell new bikes, bike parts and accessories and maintenance for bikes. This industry's dealership only sells new products, so used bikes and mass merchandisers are excluded. Despite the economy's conditions during the period, bike dealerships have performed remarkably well. This is due to the strong demand from the industry's downstream markets. During COVID-19, the closing of in-person events and the lockdown procedures crushed demand for most products. Bikes however, ended up being a popular activity for consumers to entertain themselves, stay in shape and socialize. Because of these capabilities, there was a massive influx of demand, which sustained dealerships through COVID.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Off-roading Activity During Covid-19 Boosted Demand for Certain Segments
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: As consumers dealt with lockdown procedures during 2020, many found joy in outdoor activities. Biking quickly became a popular avenue for entertainment for many. This resulted in a significant boost in demand, which sustained revenue during trying economic times.

Two major competition sources for dealerships are e-commerce stores and big-box retailers. Big-box retailers like Walmart and Target are direct competitors in this industry. However, they offer many other products and are generally a one-

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Performance isn't all good for dealerships however, as most dealerships face a high level of competition on two fronts.
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Big-box retailers and e-commerce present the biggest threat to traditional dealerships, as they can offer products at competitive pricing and provide ease of shopping. Overall, revenue for bicycle dealerships and repair grew at a CAGR of 5.3% to an estimated $8.2 billion over the past five years, including a 0.2% increase in 2023 alone, with profit levels reaching 4.5%.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Through the next period, demand is expected to fall from the heightened levels in the previous period.
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Dealerships are however, expected to be supported by the shifting age demographics of the US population. An aging population is good for the industry, because an aging population means that more people will retire, thus boosting available time for leisure activities. Rising traffic time is also set to aid industry performance through the period, the worse traffic gets, the more commuters will look for alternative ways to get to work. Overall, revenue is anticipated to grow at a CAGR of 0.2% to $8.2 billion over the five years to 2028.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: A SKYROCKETING PRICE OF OIL SUPPORTS DEMAND
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: From 2021-23, the world price of oil remained historically high. As the cost of owning and driving a car skyrocketed, many consumers would shift their mode of transportation to biking or public transportation. This resulted in sustained demand for bicycles through the end of the period.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: GROWING TRAFFIC PROBLEMS WILL PUSH MORE TO BIKE
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Traffic across many US cities has increased significantly in recent times. As employees start returning to work at an increasing pace through 2028 traffic is only expected to get worse. This presents an opportunity for bike dealerships moving forward since the increased traffic times as people return to in-person work, consumers will want faster ways to get there.

The US age demographics are shifting, overall the population is getting older. This demographic shift pushes more people to retirement age, leading to a large population with a lot more free time. With more time to spend on leisure, bike dealerships are anticipated to see bolstered demand through 2028.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Continued Support From Federal And State Governments
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: With the growing threat that increased obesity, diabetes and high blood pressure, the CDC has put these health problems as top priority moving forward. Consequently, state and local governments have been increasing funding for bike and walking paths connecting communities, making it easier to get around without a car. This will likely result in sustained demand for bikes, as they will be more accessible to more people.

industry_definition: Operators in this industry sell new bicycles, bicycle parts and accessories. Industry operators often also provide repair and maintenance services. Used bicycle stores and mass merchandisers that retail bicycles are excluded from this industry.
key_trends: An aging population leads to more people having more free time as they retire. As a result, a strong surge of demand is anticipated through 2028.
E-commerce and big-box retailers encroach into the market. This threatens downstream demand for traditional bike dealerships.
Spiking cost of crude oil bolstered demand for bikes. As the cost of using a car increased consumers looked for alternatives.

Bike dealerships get assistance from both public and private entities. With private assistance from the national bicycle dealers association and federal assistance from the alliance for biking and walking, the industry is well covered.
Drastic wait times for commutes have driven many to pick up biking. Boasting health benefits and greatly reduced commute time has bolstered demand for biking.
COVID-19 boosted demand for all biking segments. As consumers in lockdown looked for new ways to entertain themselves while social distancing.
Biking to work has become more popular in larger cities. Massachusetts and New York are good examples of people avoiding traffic by commuting by bike.
Climate and population are the two greatest drivers of demand. The West and Southeast both benefit heavily from a large consumer market and good weather throughout the year.
Low market share concentration and fragmentation brings a high level of concentration. With dealerships competing on price, distribution and product offerings.

market_segmentation.segment_description: Children and teens are still the largest downstream market by far, representing almost half of the market in 2023. Since children and teens have the freest time out of all other consumer groups, it makes sense why they remain the largest segment. COVID-19 has increased their participation in this segment as activities were much more limited during 2020.

As most establishments across the US closed in 2020, adults of all age groups had to find ways to fill their free time. The shutdowns drove many adults to try biking for both health and entertainment reasons. Now, as people return to the office, there is a larger group of adults who opt for biking as a means to commute instead of sitting in hours of traffic.

As most establishments across the US closed in 2020, adults of all age groups had to find ways to fill their free time. The shutdowns drove many adults to try biking for both health and entertainment reasons. Now, as people return to the office, there is a larger group of adults who opt for biking as a means to commute instead of sitting in hours of traffic. Lastly, the cost of oil was extremely volatile through 2023, which caused even more adults to opt for bikes, as driving became unaffordable for many, especially during 2021 and 2022.

tier_1_suppliers: Motorcycle, Bike & Parts Manufacturing in the US
Commercial Building Construction in the US
tier_2_suppliers: Sporting Goods Wholesaling in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_title: DEMAND FOR OUTDOOR AND OTHER SPORTING BIKES GREW DURING LOCKDOWN
demand_determinants.determinant_description: This grouping of bikes consists of mountain bikes, made up of 26-inch wheels and designed for offroad use. Other bikes consist of BMX bikes used for extreme sports. As activities closed to the general public in 2020, consumers sought new ways to entertain themselves.

demand_determinants.determinant_title: Historic Prices for Oil Led Many Consumers Away From Traditional Transportation
demand_determinants.determinant_description: As a result, demand jumped for off-roading bikes and other BMX-related ones. Road bikes, electric bikes and hybrid/cross bikes have all become a favorite for riders, with each of them being designed to ride long distances on paved roads.

demand_determinants.determinant_title: The Part and Repair Segment Has Benefitted From Increased Demand
demand_determinants.determinant_description: Outside of selling bikes, companies staff repair mechanics who can do most repair for bikes. Though this is a smaller business segment, it has seen immense growth as every other segment has been growing.

business_locations.location_description: The Southeast draws from a warm climate and a massive population. The weather in the Southeast allows bicycle dealerships to have consistent demand year-round. Florida and North Carolina have the highest concentration of dealerships in this region, benefitting from their large metropolitan areas since consumers can use bikes for both entertainment and transportation purposes.
A LARGE POPULATION AND WARM CLIMATE SIMILARLY DRIVE DEMAND IN THE WEST. Large metropolitan areas of California, Oregon and Washington bolster a culture of bike commuters.

Commuting into New York and Boston for work has become so bad in a car that many people opt for biking or public transportation. With large amounts of people biking to avoid high wait times in traffic, operators corner a niche area of the market.

regulations_points.regulation_description: The CPSC aims to protect the public from injury while using industry products, and will recall products if deemed unsafe.
The CPSC regulates breaking, foot breaks must be able to stop within 15 feet, and petals must have reflectors.

barriers_points.barrier_description: The repair segment of this industry requires much more labor than the dealership side, requiring highly skilled employees with technical knowledge of the products.

basis_points.basis_title: Low market share concentration and fragmentation
basis_points.basis_description: Low market share concentration and fragmentation brings a high level of concentration. With dealerships competing on price, distribution and product offerings.
Local companies have a better grasp on what the community truly wants. This can be leveraged to reach more customers, where a larger company might miss it.

concentration_points.concentration_title: Small Companies Have Access to More Niche Markets
concentration_points.concentration_description: A large number of bicycle dealerships and repair shops are small, privately owned entities with ties to local communities.

concentration_points.concentration_title: E-commerce Can Price Smaller Operators Out of the Market
concentration_points.concentration_description: During COVID-19, most stores across the US remained closed through 2020.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Purchase costs remain high for dealerships
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Purchases are the highest costs for dealerships.
In 2023 wages are anticipated to account for 10.4% of revenue.
In 2023, profit is expected to account for 4.5% of Bicycle dealership revenue.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: The repair segment of this industry requires much more labor than the dealership side, requiring highly skilled employees with technical knowledge of the products.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_title: Low rate of new patents and innovation
capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: The rate of new patent additions to the industry is low.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_title: Opportunity in lower-end and unserved markets
capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: The major markets for this industry are highly concentrated.

volatility_points.volatility_title: World cost of crude oil influences participation
volatility_points.volatility_description: Bikes are one of the more popular alternatives to cars.

volatility_points.volatility_title: Time spent on leisure varies with economic outlook
volatility_points.volatility_description: In 2020 as COVID-19 swept through the US.

FAQs.question: Does your company specialize in one corner of the market or do you retail a diversified range of products?
FAQs.answer: Most operators in this industry specialize in higher-priced bicycles.

FAQs.question: Are your company's sales heavily dependent on the health of the US economy?
FAQs.answer: The industry is affected by changes in per capita disposable income levels.

FAQs.answer: While the rise of online sales has increased competition in the industry.
